title: Will increasing the RAM of my PC affect the performance? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, it will increase the amount of tasks you can run in the background If you have to too many memory heavy tasks for your RAM to handle, your computer uses your hard drive which is exponentially slower than RAM. Adding more RAM will allow you to run more applications in the background. This is useful for video/image editing and rendering as well as running Virtual Machines, however if you have less than, say, 8GB of RAM, adding more may even help in other moderately RAM heavy tasks such as gaming and of course running Google Chrome in the background :).

Well Yes, But Unlike All the answers Your PC May be bottle necked by your GPU or The Processor Well, You have 4 GB so upgrading To 8 GB will help a Lot but Then Upgrading to 16 GB won't do much help Because There Will be Room for more Cache but There won't be Enough Cache to Fill the room…. As you Have an i3 8 GB will Do the best job For you…..

Increasing RAM in your PC will improve performance if you are currently paging or swapping. If you are unable to run some software and it tells you that it is due to insufficient memory, obviously more RAM will help. Whether or not it is worth the money depends on how you value your time.

Of course. Increasing the RAM will increase your PC’s performance. Compare yourself working in a place which has a very little room and working in a very large room. Basically RAM is used to store temporary process files and when you switch it off the files stored in RAM are gone. So more RAM means more performance.
